statements: SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_phone FROM customers;

SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_name LIKE 'A%';
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_email FROM customers ORDER BY customer_name ASC;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email, customer_address FROM customers WHERE customer_id IN (2, 3, 4);
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_phone IS NOT NULL;
SELECT * FROM Customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM Customers;
SELECT customer_phone, customer_name FROM Customers ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Orders WHERE order_amount > 1000;
SELECT customer_name, order_date, order_amount FROM Customers JOIN Orders ON Customers.customer_id = Orders.customer_id;

SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM Customers WHERE customer_phone LIKE '%123%';
SELECT order_id, order_date, order_amount FROM Orders WHERE order_amount > 1000 ORDER BY order_date DESC;
SELECT customer_name, order_date, order_amount FROM Customers JOIN Orders ON Customers.customer_id = Orders.customer_id WHERE customer_name LIKE 'A%' ORDER BY order_amount ASC;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(order_id) AS total_orders FROM Orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING total_orders > 5 ORDER BY total_orders DESC;

SELECT customer_name, SUM(sale_amount) AS total_sales FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN sales ON orders.order_id = sales.order_id GROUP BY customer_name;
